alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Boyd; Brown; Custer; Garfield; Holt; Keya Paha; Loup; Rock; Wheeler (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 13 at 3:16AM CST until January 13 at 6:00PM CST by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions due to widespread blowing snow and visibility less than one quarter mile at times. Northwest winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 6 PM CST this evening. For the Wind Chill Warning, until noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on snow covered road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Call Nebraska 511 for the latest road information.
